data.title: Mocha debug launch config should use mocha in node_modules
data.body:
Testing #19039

I don't have mocha installed globally so I needed to fiddle with it and ended up with:

```js
      "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/mocha",
      "windows": {
        "runtimeExecutable": "${workspaceRoot}/node_modules/.bin/mocha.cmd"
      },
```

Should it not use this one by default to prevent version issues?

data.title: Markdown Scroll Sync Should Map Fenced Code Blocks
data.body: Currently  fenced code blocks are not given line numbers in the generated html.

data.title: Debugging yeoman generator doesn't launch on Windows
data.body:
Testing #19039

Steps to reproduce:

1. clone https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-generator-code
2. npm install
3. npm link
4. Add Yeoman generator debug config
5. Try launch

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2193314/22275318/c19fc238-e260-11e6-939c-c2c1185a02d0.png)

Also note that I would not have known to `npm link` without the checked in header comment (which isn't included in the snippet).

data.title: Find In Files stalls in folder with 40000+ files, doesn't show results unless cancelled
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro Version 1511

I am working on a folder containing a fork of a large Meteor.js project (https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat) that contains 40000+ files.

When I first open VS Code, Find In Files works as expected: the blue SEARCH progress bar moves from left to right, search results appear as they are found, and the search ultimately concludes.

However, after several searches, the operation stalls when the progress bar is at about 90%,  and results don't appear until the search is cancelled. Even then, usually only a single result is shown.

I then need to close and restart VS Code for Find In Files to work again.

This doesn't seem to happen when working on folders with fewer (e.g. 5000) files

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/762848/22273732/210515c0-e257-11e6-907c-2c0c4a68b18a.png)

This doesn't seem to occur in other JSON files, so not sure what's up.

data.title: disable launch of VScode when installing with /verysilent
data.body:
I am performing an unattended install of VS code on windows server 2016 using a PowerShell script which continues to install other tools that are dependent on VS code. The relevant script to install VS code is  

`Start-Process ".\VSCode.exe" -ArgumentList "/verysilent /norestart" -wait`

This command installs VS code in silent mode, however, it launch VS code after installation is complete, hence my script, which is waiting for the installation to complete, continues to wait and cannot proceed to install other tools depended on vs code. 

Launching the VS code after installation in an interactive install is a great idea, however, it should be disabled in the silent install. 

My setup:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows Server 2016

data.title: [WelcomeUX] Enable experiment
Relative path in adapterExecutableCommand

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19043

In package.json, the 'program' field for a debug adapter can be a relative path, but when returned from adapterExecutableCommand, it must be an absolute path. The error message for this is not obvious (just `"read ECONNRESET"`) so I think either a relative path should be resolved, or there should be a better error message, or it should be documented that the path must be absolute.

It's a little inconvenient to resolve it to an absolute path using the __dirname of some source file in your extension.

data.title: Feature request: Search/replace preview should show differences

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The diff preview doesn't seem to actually _diff_. For example:

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 19 24 44](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/50314/22272851/d9b26420-e26a-11e6-8bc7-4872efd153d8.png)

As you can see, `ImageProcessorBehavior` is being replaced with `ImageProcessor`. Rather than showing a delete + insert, it would be sufficient — and _much_ more readable — to show that the text "Behavior" is deleted, which is the effective operation. It doesn't need to show that it's inserting anything, because it isn't actually.

data.title: Skip Files not working after initial attempt at stepping into skipped code

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
Testing #19096

Below are the 2 typescript files in my workspace and my launch.json

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16890566/22272737/ddd354ac-e250-11e6-87b0-2492e34784c6.png)

As you can see I have listed `hello.ts` as a skipped file.

Now with the `greetings.ts` as the file in the active editor, I hit F5.
- Breakpoint is hit
- Step in
- Callstack shows `sayHello` and is greyed out
- Step Over

I expect to go to the next line (line 5) in greetings.ts, but every step over actually goes thru each line in the `hello.ts` which was supposed to be skipped.
Call stack shows `sayHello` greyed out but like line numbers incrementing with each step over

data.title: Consider not updating the selection when holding arrow key up / down through search results
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19094

If you're moving through it that fast, you're not looking at anything anyways, so catching a glimpse of a random file in the middle doesn't seem all that helpful, and feels "choppy". I think updating the UI on keyup should be sufficient.

data.title: href="#" Does not Work in markdown Previews
data.body:
1. Preview markdown file with `[link](#)`
2. Click link

**Expected**
Goes to the top of the markdown preview.

**Actual**
Opens the editor for the file

This seems to be a bug in `webview-pre.js`

data.title: Using up/down arrows should only be rate-limited when there is no keyup event
data.body:
Testing #19094

Right now, in some normal use cases, there's a noticeable lag while scanning through the files using arrow keys. Would be nice to only enforce a rate limit for when someone is holding down the arrow keys

data.title: improvements in autocomplete
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
![ezgif com-631dcaef81](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16581931/22270561/ef51c04c-e26e-11e6-9c85-2d0d56cea7b1.gif)

I'm using the VSCode to work with Angular 2 and Typescript.
When i'm in the Component decorator definition, i'm getting this strange behavior.
The autocomplete don't work when the vscode Interprets an error in syntax (see the gif), only autcompletes if there is no "error", but wheni think vscode needs to autocomplete when there was an error, to correct it.

data.title: Options for automatic indentation

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Automatic indentation currently coming out of the box with VSCode is really unhelpful in any white-space significant programming language.

Twitter discussion (F#): https://twitter.com/isaac_abraham/status/824035064807731201
Problem reported in Python plugin: https://github.com/DonJayamanne/pythonVSCode/issues/666
Example behavior in F# (notice how new errors are shown after this automatic formatting):
![ident](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5427083/22271801/c3790110-e296-11e6-8b0f-cc46d874471a.gif)

As far as I understand this behavior can be controlled using `IndentationRules` in `LanguageConfiguration` but:
1. They are RegEx based which won't allow us to create accurate behavior.
2. Default behaviour is completely wrong on any white-space significant language.

I think it would be good to add option to disable this behavior.

data.title: launch.json is not created when pressing F5 for non-Node workspaces
data.body:
- Install an extension like Chrome-debug or Go that doesn't implement `startSessionCommand`
- Press F5 and select it from the "choose environment" popup
- Nothing happens

- Now in the debug viewlet, click the config icon
- The same "choose environment" popup appears
- This time, it creates the launch.json file as expected

data.title: How to open a new folder in the Extension Host window with window.openFoldersInNewWindow
data.body:
Testing https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18609

- Set `"window.openFoldersInNewWindow": true`
- Debug an extension
- The extension host window opens. I want to open a different folder, but it only opens in a new window.

Do I have to change that setting to do this or is there a workaround?

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set "window.newWindowDimensions": "inherit"

data.title: "window.newWindowDimensions": "fullscreen" opens with menubar visible
data.body:
Test item #18632 

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (4265f5e35cb3ea8ba7e0cf6b14ec606b6f8647ea, 2017-01-24T10:37:36.620Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: None

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Toggle Fullscreen in non-fullscreen window -> fullscreen without menubar
2. Open new window with "window.newWindowDimensions": "fullscreen" -> fullscreen with menubar

Seems inconsistent.

data.title: inline debugging is showing result in other paths that the code doesn't go into
data.body:
Testing #18670 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Debugging smoke test project and set the launch type as `node2`
2. Add breakpoint to `normalizePort` in `www`
3. Debug and hit breakpoints.

![screen shot 2017-01-24 at 3 07 49 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/876920/22270925/e456c96c-e246-11e6-85dc-643710eac268.png)

The if statement in line 40 is false so line 41 doesn't get executed however we are still showing value for it.
